attributes.action: Abandon the imposition of ID cards on the people of this country.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: The recent loss by a government clerk of 25 million people's personal and bank details shows that the wealth of information to be stored on ID cards will never be entirely secure no matter how much is spent on computer systems. To have our personal, banking, passport, biometric, NI number, and driving licence  details held centrally on one database is too much of a risk. This information will always be at the mercy of human error at best or criminals at worst. It's time for the British people to say 'No' to this gross invasion of our privacy.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
